/src/DLXEmu/external/imgui/backends/imgui_impl_glfw.cpp

1
// dear imgui: Platform Backend for GLFW
2
// This needs to be used along with a Renderer (e.g. OpenGL3, Vulkan, WebGPU..)
3
// (Info: GLFW is a cross-platform general purpose library for handling windows, inputs, OpenGL/Vulkan graphics context creation, etc.)
4
// (Requires: GLFW 3.1+. Prefer GLFW 3.3+ or GLFW 3.4+ for full feature support.)
5
6
// Implemented features:
7
//  [X] Platform: Clipboard support.
8
//  [X] Platform: Mouse support. Can discriminate Mouse/TouchScreen/Pen (Windows only).
9
//  [X] Platform: Keyboard support. Since 1.87 we are using the io.AddKeyEvent() function. Pass ImGuiKey values to all key functions e.g. ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space). [Legacy GLFW_KEY_* values will also be supported unless IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO is set]
10
//  [X] Platform: Gamepad support. Enable with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad'.
11
//  [X] Platform: Mouse cursor shape and visibility. Disable with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange' (note: the resizing cursors requires GLFW 3.4+).
12
//  [X] Platform: Multi-viewport support (multiple windows). Enable with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
13
// Issues:
14
//  [ ] Platform: Multi-viewport: ParentViewportID not honored, and so io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent has no effect (minor).
15
16
// You can use unmodified imgui_impl_* files in your project. See examples/ folder for examples of using this.
17
// Prefer including the entire imgui/ repository into your project (either as a copy or as a submodule), and only build the backends you need.
18
// Learn about Dear ImGui:
19
// - FAQ                  https://dearimgui.com/faq
20
// - Getting Started      https://dearimgui.com/getting-started
21
// - Documentation        https://dearimgui.com/docs (same as your local docs/ folder).
22
// - Introduction, links and more at the top of imgui.cpp
23
24
// CHANGELOG
25
// (minor and older changes stripped away, please see git history for details)
26
//  2024-XX-XX: Platform: Added support for multiple windows via the ImGuiPlatformIO interface.
27
//  2024-07-31: Added ImGui_ImplGlfw_Sleep() helper function for usage by our examples app, since GLFW doesn't provide one.
28
//  2024-07-08: *BREAKING* Renamed ImGui_ImplGlfw_InstallEmscriptenCanvasResizeCallback to ImGui_ImplGlfw_InstallEmscriptenCallbacks(), added GLFWWindow* parameter.
29
//  2024-07-08: Emscripten: Added support for GLFW3 contrib port (GLFW 3.4.0 features + bug fixes): to enable, replace -sUSE_GLFW=3 with --use-port=contrib.glfw3 (requires emscripten 3.1.59+) (https://github.com/pongasoft/emscripten-glfw)
30
//  2024-07-02: Emscripten: Added io.PlatformOpenInShellFn() handler for Emscripten versions.
31
//  2023-12-19: Emscripten: Added ImGui_ImplGlfw_InstallEmscriptenCanvasResizeCallback() to register canvas selector and auto-resize GLFW window.
32
//  2023-10-05: Inputs: Added support for extra ImGuiKey values: F13 to F24 function keys.
33
//  2023-07-18: Inputs: Revert ignoring mouse data on GLFW_CURSOR_DISABLED as it can be used differently. User may set ImGuiConfigFLags_NoMouse if desired. (#5625, #6609)
34
//  2023-06-12: Accept glfwGetTime() not returning a monotonically increasing value. This seems to happens on some Windows setup when peripherals disconnect, and is likely to also happen on browser + Emscripten. (#6491)
35
//  2023-04-04: Inputs: Added support for io.AddMouseSourceEvent() to discriminate ImGuiMouseSource_Mouse/ImGuiMouseSource_TouchScreen/ImGuiMouseSource_Pen on Windows ONLY, using a custom WndProc hook. (#2702)
36
//  2023-03-16: Inputs: Fixed key modifiers handling on secondary viewports (docking branch). Broken on 2023/01/04. (#6248, #6034)
37
//  2023-03-14: Emscripten: Avoid using glfwGetError() and glfwGetGamepadState() which are not correctly implemented in Emscripten emulation. (#6240)
38
//  2023-02-03: Emscripten: Registering custom low-level mouse wheel handler to get more accurate scrolling impulses on Emscripten. (#4019, #6096)
39
//  2023-01-18: Handle unsupported glfwGetVideoMode() call on e.g. Emscripten.
40
//  2023-01-04: Inputs: Fixed mods state on Linux when using Alt-GR text input (e.g. German keyboard layout), could lead to broken text input. Revert a 2022/01/17 change were we resumed using mods provided by GLFW, turns out they were faulty.
41
//  2022-11-22: Perform a dummy glfwGetError() read to cancel missing names with glfwGetKeyName(). (#5908)
42
//  2022-10-18: Perform a dummy glfwGetError() read to cancel missing mouse cursors errors. Using GLFW_VERSION_COMBINED directly. (#5785)
43
//  2022-10-11: Using 'nullptr' instead of 'NULL' as per our switch to C++11.
44
//  2022-09-26: Inputs: Renamed ImGuiKey_ModXXX introduced in 1.87 to ImGuiMod_XXX (old names still supported).
45
//  2022-09-01: Inputs: Honor GLFW_CURSOR_DISABLED by not setting mouse position *EDIT* Reverted 2023-07-18.
46
//  2022-04-30: Inputs: Fixed ImGui_ImplGlfw_TranslateUntranslatedKey() for lower case letters on OSX.
47
//  2022-03-23: Inputs: Fixed a regression in 1.87 which resulted in keyboard modifiers events being reported incorrectly on Linux/X11.
48
//  2022-02-07: Added ImGui_ImplGlfw_InstallCallbacks()/ImGui_ImplGlfw_RestoreCallbacks() helpers to facilitate user installing callbacks after initializing backend.
49
//  2022-01-26: Inputs: replaced short-lived io.AddKeyModsEvent() (added two weeks ago) with io.AddKeyEvent() using ImGuiKey_ModXXX flags. Sorry for the confusion.
50
//  2021-01-20: Inputs: calling new io.AddKeyAnalogEvent() for gamepad support, instead of writing directly to io.NavInputs[].
51
//  2022-01-17: Inputs: calling new io.AddMousePosEvent(), io.AddMouseButtonEvent(), io.AddMouseWheelEvent() API (1.87+).
52
//  2022-01-17: Inputs: always update key mods next and before key event (not in NewFrame) to fix input queue with very low framerates.
53
//  2022-01-12: *BREAKING CHANGE*: Now using glfwSetCursorPosCallback(). If you called ImGui_ImplGlfw_InitXXX() with install_callbacks = false, you MUST install glfwSetCursorPosCallback() and forward it to the backend via ImGui_ImplGlfw_CursorPosCallback().
54
//  2022-01-10: Inputs: calling new io.AddKeyEvent(), io.AddKeyModsEvent() + io.SetKeyEventNativeData() API (1.87+). Support for full ImGuiKey range.
55
//  2022-01-05: Inputs: Converting GLFW untranslated keycodes back to translated keycodes (in the ImGui_ImplGlfw_KeyCallback() function) in order to match the behavior of every other backend, and facilitate the use of GLFW with lettered-shortcuts API.
56
//  2021-08-17: *BREAKING CHANGE*: Now using glfwSetWindowFocusCallback() to calling io.AddFocusEvent(). If you called ImGui_ImplGlfw_InitXXX() with install_callbacks = false, you MUST install glfwSetWindowFocusCallback() and forward it to the backend via ImGui_ImplGlfw_WindowFocusCallback().
57
//  2021-07-29: *BREAKING CHANGE*: Now using glfwSetCursorEnterCallback(). MousePos is correctly reported when the host platform window is hovered but not focused. If you called ImGui_ImplGlfw_InitXXX() with install_callbacks = false, you MUST install glfwSetWindowFocusCallback() callback and forward it to the backend via ImGui_ImplGlfw_CursorEnterCallback().
58
//  2021-06-29: Reorganized backend to pull data from a single structure to facilitate usage with multiple-contexts (all g_XXXX access changed to bd->XXXX).
59
//  2020-01-17: Inputs: Disable error callback while assigning mouse cursors because some X11 setup don't have them and it generates errors.
60
//  2019-12-05: Inputs: Added support for new mouse cursors added in GLFW 3.4+ (resizing cursors, not allowed cursor).
61
//  2019-10-18: Misc: Previously installed user callbacks are now restored on shutdown.
62
//  2019-07-21: Inputs: Added mapping for ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter.
63
//  2019-05-11: Inputs: Don't filter value from character callback before calling AddInputCharacter().
64
//  2019-03-12: Misc: Preserve DisplayFramebufferScale when main window is minimized.
65
//  2018-11-30: Misc: Setting up io.BackendPlatformName so it can be displayed in the About Window.
66
//  2018-11-07: Inputs: When installing our GLFW callbacks, we save user's previously installed ones - if any - and chain call them.
67
//  2018-08-01: Inputs: Workaround for Emscripten which doesn't seem to handle focus related calls.
68
//  2018-06-29: Inputs: Added support for the ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand cursor.
69
//  2018-06-08: Misc: Extracted imgui_impl_glfw.cpp/.h away from the old combined GLFW+OpenGL/Vulkan examples.
70
//  2018-03-20: Misc: Setup io.BackendFlags ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors flag + honor ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange flag.
71
//  2018-02-20: Inputs: Added support for mouse cursors (ImGui::GetMouseCursor() value, passed to glfwSetCursor()).
72
//  2018-02-06: Misc: Removed call to ImGui::Shutdown() which is not available from 1.60 WIP, user needs to call CreateContext/DestroyContext themselves.
73
//  2018-02-06: Inputs: Added mapping for ImGuiKey_Space.
74
//  2018-01-25: Inputs: Added gamepad support if ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad is set.
75
//  2018-01-25: Inputs: Honoring the io.WantSetMousePos by repositioning the mouse (when using navigation and ImGuiConfigFlags_NavMoveMouse is set).
76
//  2018-01-20: Inputs: Added Horizontal Mouse Wheel support.
77
//  2018-01-18: Inputs: Added mapping for ImGuiKey_Insert.
78
//  2017-08-25: Inputs: MousePos set to -FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX when mouse is unavailable/missing (instead of -1,-1).
79
//  2016-10-15: Misc: Added a void* user_data parameter to Clipboard function handlers.
80

// We gather version tests as define in order to easily see which features are version-dependent.
123
#define GLFW_VERSION_COMBINED           (GLFW_VERSION_MAJOR * 1000 + GLFW_VERSION_MINOR * 100 + GLFW_VERSION_REVISION)
124
#define GLFW_HAS_WINDOW_TOPMOST         (GLFW_VERSION_COMBINED >= 3200) // 3.2+ GLFW_FLOATING
125
#define GLFW_HAS_WINDOW_HOVERED         (GLFW_VERSION_COMBINED >= 3300) // 3.3+ GLFW_HOVERED
126
#define GLFW_HAS_WINDOW_ALPHA           (GLFW_VERSION_COMBINED >= 3300) // 3.3+ glfwSetWindowOpacity
127
#define GLFW_HAS_PER_MONITOR_DPI        (GLFW_VERSION_COMBINED >= 3300) // 3.3+ glfwGetMonitorContentScale
128
#if defined(__EMSCRIPTEN__) || defined(__SWITCH__)                      // no Vulkan support in GLFW for Emscripten or homebrew Nintendo Switch
129
#define GLFW_HAS_VULKAN                 (0)

#endif

191
// Backend data stored in io.BackendPlatformUserData to allow support for multiple Dear ImGui contexts
192
// It is STRONGLY preferred that you use docking branch with multi-viewports (== single Dear ImGui context + multiple windows) instead of multiple Dear ImGui contexts.
193
// FIXME: multi-context support is not well tested and probably dysfunctional in this backend.
194
// - Because glfwPollEvents() process all windows and some events may be called outside of it, you will need to register your own callbacks
195
//   (passing install_callbacks=false in ImGui_ImplGlfw_InitXXX functions), set the current dear imgui context and then call our callbacks.
196
// - Otherwise we may need to store a GLFWWindow* -> ImGuiContext* map and handle this in the backend, adding a little bit of extra complexity to it.
197
// FIXME: some shared resources (mouse cursor shape, gamepad) are mishandled when using multi-context.
198
static ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData()
199
0
{
200
0
    return ImGui::GetCurrentContext() ? (ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data*)ImGui::GetIO().BackendPlatformUserData : nullptr;
201
0
}

static void ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateKeyModifiers(GLFWwindow* window)
347
0

348
0
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
349
0

350
0
    io.AddKeyEvent(ImGuiMod_Shift, (glfwGetKey(window, GLFW_KEY_LEFT_SHIFT)   == GLFW_PRESS) || (glfwGetKey(window, GLFW_KEY_RIGHT_SHIFT)   == GLFW_PRESS));
351
0
    io.AddKeyEvent(ImGuiMod_Alt,   (glfwGetKey(window, GLFW_KEY_LEFT_ALT)     == GLFW_PRESS) || (glfwGetKey(window, GLFW_KEY_RIGHT_ALT)     == GLFW_PRESS));
352
0
    io.AddKeyEvent(ImGuiMod_Super, (glfwGetKey(window, GLFW_KEY_LEFT_SUPER)   == GLFW_PRESS) || (glfwGetKey(window, GLFW_KEY_RIGHT_SUPER)   == GLFW_PRESS));

0

389
static int ImGui_ImplGlfw_TranslateUntranslatedKey(int key, int scancode)
390
0
{
391
0
#if GLFW_HAS_GETKEYNAME && !defined(EMSCRIPTEN_USE_EMBEDDED_GLFW3)
392
    // GLFW 3.1+ attempts to "untranslate" keys, which goes the opposite of what every other framework does, making using lettered shortcuts difficult.
393
    // (It had reasons to do so: namely GLFW is/was more likely to be used for WASD-type game controls rather than lettered shortcuts, but IHMO the 3.1 change could have been done differently)
394
    // See https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1502 for details.
395
    // Adding a workaround to undo this (so our keys are translated->untranslated->translated, likely a lossy process).
396
    // This won't cover edge cases but this is at least going to cover common cases.
397
0
    if (key >= GLFW_KEY_KP_0 && key <= GLFW_KEY_KP_EQUAL)
398
0
        return key;
399
0
    GLFWerrorfun prev_error_callback = glfwSetErrorCallback(nullptr);
400
0
    const char* key_name = glfwGetKeyName(key, scancode);
401
0
    glfwSetErrorCallback(prev_error_callback);
402
0
#if GLFW_HAS_GETERROR && !defined(EMSCRIPTEN_USE_EMBEDDED_GLFW3) // Eat errors (see #5908)
403
0
    (void)glfwGetError(nullptr);
404
0
#endif
405
0
    if (key_name && key_name[0] != 0 && key_name[1] == 0)
406
0
    {
407
0
        const char char_names[] = "`-=[]\\,;\'./";
408
0
        const int char_keys[] = { GLFW_KEY_GRAVE_ACCENT, GLFW_KEY_MINUS, GLFW_KEY_EQUAL, GLFW_KEY_LEFT_BRACKET, GLFW_KEY_RIGHT_BRACKET, GLFW_KEY_BACKSLASH, GLFW_KEY_COMMA, GLFW_KEY_SEMICOLON, GLFW_KEY_APOSTROPHE, GLFW_KEY_PERIOD, GLFW_KEY_SLASH, 0 };
409
0
        IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(char_names) == IM_ARRAYSIZE(char_keys));
410
0
        if (key_name[0] >= '0' && key_name[0] <= '9')               { key = GLFW_KEY_0 + (key_name[0] - '0'); }
411
0
        else if (key_name[0] >= 'A' && key_name[0] <= 'Z')          { key = GLFW_KEY_A + (key_name[0] - 'A'); }
412
0
        else if (key_name[0] >= 'a' && key_name[0] <= 'z')          { key = GLFW_KEY_A + (key_name[0] - 'a'); }
413
0
        else if (const char* p = strchr(char_names, key_name[0]))   { key = char_keys[p - char_names]; }
414
0
    }
415
    // if (action == GLFW_PRESS) printf("key %d scancode %d name '%s'\n", key, scancode, key_name);
416
#else
417
    IM_UNUSED(scancode);
418
#endif
419
0
    return key;
420
0
}

423
0
{
424
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
425
0
    if (bd->PrevUserCallbackKey != nullptr && ImGui_ImplGlfw_ShouldChainCallback(window))
426
0
        bd->PrevUserCallbackKey(window, keycode, scancode, action, mods);
427
428
0
    if (action != GLFW_PRESS && action != GLFW_RELEASE)
429
0
        return;
430
431
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateKeyModifiers(window);
432
433
0
    if (keycode >= 0 && keycode < IM_ARRAYSIZE(bd->KeyOwnerWindows))
434
0
        bd->KeyOwnerWindows[keycode] = (action == GLFW_PRESS) ? window : nullptr;
435
436
0
    keycode = ImGui_ImplGlfw_TranslateUntranslatedKey(keycode, scancode);
437
438
0

439
0

440
0

441
0

442
0
}

510
#ifdef EMSCRIPTEN_USE_EMBEDDED_GLFW3
511
static EM_BOOL ImGui_ImplEmscripten_WheelCallback(int, const EmscriptenWheelEvent* ev, void*)
512
{
513
    // Mimic Emscripten_HandleWheel() in SDL.
514
    // Corresponding equivalent in GLFW JS emulation layer has incorrect quantizing preventing small values. See #6096
515
    float multiplier = 0.0f;
516
    if (ev->deltaMode == DOM_DELTA_PIXEL)       { multiplier = 1.0f / 100.0f; } // 100 pixels make up a step.
517
    else if (ev->deltaMode == DOM_DELTA_LINE)   { multiplier = 1.0f / 3.0f; }   // 3 lines make up a step.
518
    else if (ev->deltaMode == DOM_DELTA_PAGE)   { multiplier = 80.0f; }         // A page makes up 80 steps.
519
    float wheel_x = ev->deltaX * -multiplier;
520
    float wheel_y = ev->deltaY * -multiplier;
521
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
522
    io.AddMouseWheelEvent(wheel_x, wheel_y);
523
    //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("[Emsc] mode %d dx: %.2f, dy: %.2f, dz: %.2f --> feed %.2f %.2f\n", (int)ev->deltaMode, ev->deltaX, ev->deltaY, ev->deltaZ, wheel_x, wheel_y);
524
    return EM_TRUE;
525
}
526
#endif

538

539
0
    bd->PrevUserCallbackCursorEnter = glfwSetCursorEnterCallback(window, ImGui_ImplGlfw_CursorEnterCallback);
540
0

544
0
    bd->PrevUserCallbackChar = glfwSetCharCallback(window, ImGui_ImplGlfw_CharCallback);
545
0
    bd->PrevUserCallbackMonitor = glfwSetMonitorCallback(ImGui_ImplGlfw_MonitorCallback);
546

// Set to 'true' to enable chaining installed callbacks for all windows (including secondary viewports created by backends or by user.
575
// This is 'false' by default meaning we only chain callbacks for the main viewport.
576
// We cannot set this to 'true' by default because user callbacks code may be not testing the 'window' parameter of their callback.
577
// If you set this to 'true' your user callback code will need to make sure you are testing the 'window' parameter.
578
void ImGui_ImplGlfw_SetCallbacksChainForAllWindows(bool chain_for_all_windows)
579
0
{
580
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
581
0
    bd->CallbacksChainForAllWindows = chain_for_all_windows;

0
}

0
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();

599

    // Chain GLFW callbacks: our callbacks will call the user's previously installed callbacks, if any.

#ifdef _WIN32

658
#elif defined(__APPLE__)

    main_viewport->PlatformHandleRaw = (void*)glfwGetCocoaWindow(bd->Window);
660
#else

0

663
0
    if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)

671
#endif
672
673
0
    bd->ClientApi = client_api;
674
0
    return true;

0
{

0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
695
0

0

static void ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateMouseData()
724
0
{
725
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
726
0
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
727
0
    ImGuiPlatformIO& platform_io = ImGui::GetPlatformIO();
728
729
0
    ImGuiID mouse_viewport_id = 0;
730
0
    const ImVec2 mouse_pos_prev = io.MousePos;
731
0
    for (int n = 0; n < platform_io.Viewports.Size; n++)
732
0
    {
733
0
        ImGuiViewport* viewport = platform_io.Viewports[n];
734
0
        GLFWwindow* window = (GLFWwindow*)viewport->PlatformHandle;
735
736
#ifdef EMSCRIPTEN_USE_EMBEDDED_GLFW3
737
        const bool is_window_focused = true;
738
#else
739
0
        const bool is_window_focused = glfwGetWindowAttrib(window, GLFW_FOCUSED) != 0;
740
0
#endif
741
0
        if (is_window_focused)
742
0
        {
743
            // (Optional) Set OS mouse position from Dear ImGui if requested (rarely used, only when ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos is enabled by user)
744
            // When multi-viewports are enabled, all Dear ImGui positions are same as OS positions.
745
0
            if (io.WantSetMousePos)
746
0
                glfwSetCursorPos(window, (double)(mouse_pos_prev.x - viewport->Pos.x), (double)(mouse_pos_prev.y - viewport->Pos.y));
747
748
            // (Optional) Fallback to provide mouse position when focused (ImGui_ImplGlfw_CursorPosCallback already provides this when hovered or captured)
749
0
            if (bd->MouseWindow == nullptr)
750
0
            {
751
0
                double mouse_x, mouse_y;
752
0
                glfwGetCursorPos(window, &mouse_x, &mouse_y);
753
0
                if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
754
0
                {
755
                    // Single viewport mode: mouse position in client window coordinates (io.MousePos is (0,0) when the mouse is on the upper-left corner of the app window)
756
                    // Multi-viewport mode: mouse position in OS absolute coordinates (io.MousePos is (0,0) when the mouse is on the upper-left of the primary monitor)
757
0
                    int window_x, window_y;
758
0
                    glfwGetWindowPos(window, &window_x, &window_y);
759
0
                    mouse_x += window_x;
760
0
                    mouse_y += window_y;
761
0
                }
762
0
                bd->LastValidMousePos = ImVec2((float)mouse_x, (float)mouse_y);
763
0
                io.AddMousePosEvent((float)mouse_x, (float)mouse_y);
764
0
            }
765
0
        }
766
767
        // (Optional) When using multiple viewports: call io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport the OS mouse cursor is hovering.
768
        // If ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport is not set by the backend, Dear imGui will ignore this field and infer the information using its flawed heuristic.
769
        // - [X] GLFW >= 3.3 backend ON WINDOWS ONLY does correctly ignore viewports with the _NoInputs flag (since we implement hit via our WndProc hook)
770
        //       On other platforms we rely on the library fallbacking to its own search when reporting a viewport with _NoInputs flag.
771
        // - [!] GLFW <= 3.2 backend CANNOT correctly ignore viewports with the _NoInputs flag, and CANNOT reported Hovered Viewport because of mouse capture.
772
        //       Some backend are not able to handle that correctly. If a backend report an hovered viewport that has the _NoInputs flag (e.g. when dragging a window
773
        //       for docking, the viewport has the _NoInputs flag in order to allow us to find the viewport under), then Dear ImGui is forced to ignore the value reported
774
        //       by the backend, and use its flawed heuristic to guess the viewport behind.
775
        // - [X] GLFW backend correctly reports this regardless of another viewport behind focused and dragged from (we need this to find a useful drag and drop target).
776
        // FIXME: This is currently only correct on Win32. See what we do below with the WM_NCHITTEST, missing an equivalent for other systems.
777
        // See https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1236 if you want to help in making this a GLFW feature.
778
0
#if GLFW_HAS_MOUSE_PASSTHROUGH
779
0
        const bool window_no_input = (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs) != 0;
780
0
        glfwSetWindowAttrib(window, GLFW_MOUSE_PASSTHROUGH, window_no_input);
781
0
#endif
782
0
#if GLFW_HAS_MOUSE_PASSTHROUGH || GLFW_HAS_WINDOW_HOVERED
783
0
        if (glfwGetWindowAttrib(window, GLFW_HOVERED))
784
0
            mouse_viewport_id = viewport->ID;
785
#else
786
        // We cannot use bd->MouseWindow maintained from CursorEnter/Leave callbacks, because it is locked to the window capturing mouse.
787
#endif
788
0
    }
789
790
0
    if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport)
791
0
        io.AddMouseViewportEvent(mouse_viewport_id);
792
0
}

// Update gamepad inputs
822
0
static inline float Saturate(float v) { return v < 0.0f ? 0.0f : v  > 1.0f ? 1.0f : v; }
823
static void ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateGamepads()
824
0
{
825
0
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
826
0
    if ((io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) == 0) // FIXME: Technically feeding gamepad shouldn't depend on this now that they are regular inputs.
827
0
        return;
828
829
0
    io.BackendFlags &= ~ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad;
830
0
#if GLFW_HAS_GAMEPAD_API && !defined(EMSCRIPTEN_USE_EMBEDDED_GLFW3)
831
0
    GLFWgamepadstate gamepad;
832
0
    if (!glfwGetGamepadState(GLFW_JOYSTICK_1, &gamepad))
833
0
        return;
834
0
    #define MAP_BUTTON(KEY_NO, BUTTON_NO, _UNUSED)          do { io.AddKeyEvent(KEY_NO, gamepad.buttons[BUTTON_NO] != 0); } while (0)
835
0
    #define MAP_ANALOG(KEY_NO, AXIS_NO, _UNUSED, V0, V1)    do { float v = gamepad.axes[AXIS_NO]; v = (v - V0) / (V1 - V0); io.AddKeyAnalogEvent(KEY_NO, v > 0.10f, Saturate(v)); } while (0)
836
#else
837
    int axes_count = 0, buttons_count = 0;
838
    const float* axes = glfwGetJoystickAxes(GLFW_JOYSTICK_1, &axes_count);
839
    const unsigned char* buttons = glfwGetJoystickButtons(GLFW_JOYSTICK_1, &buttons_count);
840
    if (axes_count == 0 || buttons_count == 0)
841
        return;
842
    #define MAP_BUTTON(KEY_NO, _UNUSED, BUTTON_NO)          do { io.AddKeyEvent(KEY_NO, (buttons_count > BUTTON_NO && buttons[BUTTON_NO] == GLFW_PRESS)); } while (0)
843
    #define MAP_ANALOG(KEY_NO, _UNUSED, AXIS_NO, V0, V1)    do { float v = (axes_count > AXIS_NO) ? axes[AXIS_NO] : V0; v = (v - V0) / (V1 - V0); io.AddKeyAnalogEvent(KEY_NO, v > 0.10f, Saturate(v)); } while (0)
844
#endif
845
0
    io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad;
846
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadStart,       GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_START,          7);
847
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadBack,        GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_BACK,           6);
848
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft,    GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_X,              2);     // Xbox X, PS Square
849
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight,   GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_B,              1);     // Xbox B, PS Circle
850
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp,      GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_Y,              3);     // Xbox Y, PS Triangle
851
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown,    GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_A,              0);     // Xbox A, PS Cross

0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadL1,          GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_BUMPER,    4);
857
0
    MAP_BUTTON(ImGuiKey_GamepadR1,          GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_BUMPER,   5);

0
    MAP_ANALOG(ImGuiKey_GamepadL2,          GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER,     4,      -0.75f,  +1.0f);

0

882
0

0
        return;
884
885
0

886
0

890

0

892
0

893
0

894
0

0

0
#if GLFW_HAS_MONITOR_WORK_AREA
897

898
0

void ImGui_ImplGlfw_NewFrame()
917
0
{
918
0
    ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
919
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
920
0
    IM_ASSERT(bd != nullptr && "Context or backend not initialized! Did you call ImGui_ImplGlfw_InitForXXX()?");
921
922
    // Setup display size (every frame to accommodate for window resizing)
923
0
    int w, h;
924
0
    int display_w, display_h;
925
0
    glfwGetWindowSize(bd->Window, &w, &h);
926
0
    glfwGetFramebufferSize(bd->Window, &display_w, &display_h);
927
0

928
0
    if (w > 0 && h > 0)
929
0
        io.DisplayFramebufferScale = ImVec2((float)display_w / (float)w, (float)display_h / (float)h);
930
0
    if (bd->WantUpdateMonitors)
931
0
        ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateMonitors();
932
933
    // Setup time step
934
    // (Accept glfwGetTime() not returning a monotonically increasing value. Seems to happens on disconnecting peripherals and probably on VMs and Emscripten, see #6491, #6189, #6114, #3644)
935
0
    double current_time = glfwGetTime();
936
0
    if (current_time <= bd->Time)
937
0
        current_time = bd->Time + 0.00001f;
938
0
    io.DeltaTime = bd->Time > 0.0 ? (float)(current_time - bd->Time) : (float)(1.0f / 60.0f);
939
0
    bd->Time = current_time;
940
941
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateMouseData();
942
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateMouseCursor();
943
944
    // Update game controllers (if enabled and available)
945
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_UpdateGamepads();
946
0

static EM_BOOL ImGui_ImplGlfw_OnCanvasSizeChange(int event_type, const EmscriptenUiEvent* event, void* user_data)
960
{
961
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = (ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data*)user_data;
962
    double canvas_width, canvas_height;
963
    emscripten_get_element_css_size(bd->CanvasSelector, &canvas_width, &canvas_height);
964

965
    return true;
966

static EM_BOOL ImGui_ImplEmscripten_FullscreenChangeCallback(int event_type, const EmscriptenFullscreenChangeEvent* event, void* user_data)
969
{
970
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = (ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data*)user_data;
971

977
// 'canvas_selector' is a CSS selector. The event listener is applied to the first element that matches the query.
978
// STRING MUST PERSIST FOR THE APPLICATION DURATION. PLEASE USE A STRING LITERAL OR ENSURE POINTER WILL STAY VALID.
979
void ImGui_ImplGlfw_InstallEmscriptenCallbacks(GLFWwindow*, const char* canvas_selector)
980
{
981
    IM_ASSERT(canvas_selector != nullptr);
982
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
983
    IM_ASSERT(bd != nullptr && "Context or backend not initialized! Did you call ImGui_ImplGlfw_InitForXXX()?");
984
985
    bd->CanvasSelector = canvas_selector;
986
    emscripten_set_resize_callback(EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TARGET_WINDOW, bd, false, ImGui_ImplGlfw_OnCanvasSizeChange);
987
    emscripten_set_fullscreenchange_callback(EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TARGET_DOCUMENT, bd, false, ImGui_ImplEmscripten_FullscreenChangeCallback);
988
989
    // Change the size of the GLFW window according to the size of the canvas
990
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_OnCanvasSizeChange(EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_RESIZE, {}, bd);
991
992
    // Register Emscripten Wheel callback to workaround issue in Emscripten GLFW Emulation (#6096)
993
    // We intentionally do not check 'if (install_callbacks)' here, as some users may set it to false and call GLFW callback themselves.
994
    // FIXME: May break chaining in case user registered their own Emscripten callback?
995
    emscripten_set_wheel_callback(bd->CanvasSelector, nullptr, false, ImGui_ImplEmscripten_WheelCallback);
996
}
997
#elif defined(EMSCRIPTEN_USE_PORT_CONTRIB_GLFW3)
998
// When using --use-port=contrib.glfw3 for the GLFW implementation, you can override the behavior of this call
999
// by invoking emscripten_glfw_make_canvas_resizable afterward.
1000
// See https://github.com/pongasoft/emscripten-glfw/blob/master/docs/Usage.md#how-to-make-the-canvas-resizable-by-the-user for an explanation
1001
void ImGui_ImplGlfw_InstallEmscriptenCallbacks(GLFWwindow* window, const char* canvas_selector)
1002
{
1003
  GLFWwindow* w = (GLFWwindow*)(EM_ASM_INT({ return Module.glfwGetWindow(UTF8ToString($0)); }, canvas_selector));
1004
  IM_ASSERT(window == w); // Sanity check
1005
  IM_UNUSED(w);
1006
  emscripten_glfw_make_canvas_resizable(window, "window", nullptr);

    ~ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData() { IM_ASSERT(Window == nullptr); }

// GLFW may dispatch window pos/size events after calling glfwSetWindowPos()/glfwSetWindowSize().
1039
// However: depending on the platform the callback may be invoked at different time:
1040
// - on Windows it appears to be called within the glfwSetWindowPos()/glfwSetWindowSize() call
1041
// - on Linux it is queued and invoked during glfwPollEvents()
1042
// Because the event doesn't always fire on glfwSetWindowXXX() we use a frame counter tag to only
1043
// ignore recent glfwSetWindowXXX() calls.
1044
static void ImGui_ImplGlfw_WindowPosCallback(GLFWwindow* window, int, int)
1045
0
{
1046
0
    if (ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::FindViewportByPlatformHandle(window))
1047
0
    {
1048
0
        if (ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData* vd = (ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData*)viewport->PlatformUserData)
1049
0
        {
1050
0
            bool ignore_event = (ImGui::GetFrameCount() <= vd->IgnoreWindowPosEventFrame + 1);
1051
            //data->IgnoreWindowPosEventFrame = -1;
1052
0
            if (ignore_event)
1053
0
                return;
1054
0
        }
1055
0
        viewport->PlatformRequestMove = true;
1056
0
    }
1057
0
}

static void ImGui_ImplGlfw_SetWindowSize(ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImVec2 size)
1208
0
{
1209
0
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData* vd = (ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData*)viewport->PlatformUserData;
1210
#if __APPLE__ && !GLFW_HAS_OSX_WINDOW_POS_FIX
1211
    // Native OS windows are positioned from the bottom-left corner on macOS, whereas on other platforms they are
1212
    // positioned from the upper-left corner. GLFW makes an effort to convert macOS style coordinates, however it
1213
    // doesn't handle it when changing size. We are manually moving the window in order for changes of size to be based
1214
    // on the upper-left corner.
1215
    int x, y, width, height;
1216
    glfwGetWindowPos(vd->Window, &x, &y);
1217
    glfwGetWindowSize(vd->Window, &width, &height);
1218
    glfwSetWindowPos(vd->Window, x, y - height + size.y);
1219
#endif
1220
0
    vd->IgnoreWindowSizeEventFrame = ImGui::GetFrameCount();
1221
0
    glfwSetWindowSize(vd->Window, (int)size.x, (int)size.y);
1222
0
}

// Vulkan support (the Vulkan renderer needs to call a platform-side support function to create the surface)
1282

1283
1284
// Avoid including <vulkan.h> so we can build without it
1285
#if GLFW_HAS_VULKAN
1286
#ifndef VULKAN_H_
1287
#define VK_DEFINE_HANDLE(object) typedef struct object##_T* object;
1288
#if defined(__LP64__) || defined(_WIN64) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(_M_X64) || defined(__ia64) || defined (_M_IA64) || defined(__aarch64__) || defined(__powerpc64__)
1289
#define VK_DEFINE_NON_DISPATCHABLE_HANDLE(object) typedef struct object##_T *object;
1290
#else
1291
#define VK_DEFINE_NON_DISPATCHABLE_HANDLE(object) typedef uint64_t object;
1292
#endif
1293
VK_DEFINE_HANDLE(VkInstance)
1294
VK_DEFINE_NON_DISPATCHABLE_HANDLE(VkSurfaceKHR)
1295
struct VkAllocationCallbacks;
1296
enum VkResult { VK_RESULT_MAX_ENUM = 0x7FFFFFFF };
1297
#endif // VULKAN_H_

extern "C" { extern GLFWAPI VkResult glfwCreateWindowSurface(VkInstance instance, GLFWwindow* window, const VkAllocationCallbacks* allocator, VkSurfaceKHR* surface); }
1299

0

0

1303
0

1304
0
    IM_ASSERT(bd->ClientApi == GlfwClientApi_Vulkan);
1305
0

1306
0
    return (int)err;

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1351
1352
// WndProc hook (declared here because we will need access to ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData)
1353
#ifdef _WIN32
1354
static ImGuiMouseSource GetMouseSourceFromMessageExtraInfo()
1355
{
1356
    LPARAM extra_info = ::GetMessageExtraInfo();
1357
    if ((extra_info & 0xFFFFFF80) == 0xFF515700)
1358
        return ImGuiMouseSource_Pen;
1359
    if ((extra_info & 0xFFFFFF80) == 0xFF515780)
1360
        return ImGuiMouseSource_TouchScreen;
1361
    return ImGuiMouseSource_Mouse;
1362
}
1363
static LRESULT CALLBACK ImGui_ImplGlfw_WndProc(HWND hWnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
1364
{
1365
    ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data* bd = ImGui_ImplGlfw_GetBackendData();
1366
    WNDPROC prev_wndproc = bd->PrevWndProc;
1367
    ImGuiViewport* viewport = (ImGuiViewport*)::GetPropA(hWnd, "IMGUI_VIEWPORT");
1368
    if (viewport != NULL)
1369
        if (ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData* vd = (ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData*)viewport->PlatformUserData)
1370
            prev_wndproc = vd->PrevWndProc;
1371
1372
    switch (msg)
1373
    {
1374
        // GLFW doesn't allow to distinguish Mouse vs TouchScreen vs Pen.
1375
        // Add support for Win32 (based on imgui_impl_win32), because we rely on _TouchScreen info to trickle inputs differently.
1376
    case WM_MOUSEMOVE: case WM_NCMOUSEMOVE:
1377
    case WM_LBUTTONDOWN: case WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK: case WM_LBUTTONUP:
1378
    case WM_RBUTTONDOWN: case WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK: case WM_RBUTTONUP:
1379
    case WM_MBUTTONDOWN: case WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK: case WM_MBUTTONUP:
1380
    case WM_XBUTTONDOWN: case WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK: case WM_XBUTTONUP:
1381
        ImGui::GetIO().AddMouseSourceEvent(GetMouseSourceFromMessageExtraInfo());
1382
        break;
1383
1384
        // We have submitted https://github.com/glfw/glfw/pull/1568 to allow GLFW to support "transparent inputs".
1385
        // In the meanwhile we implement custom per-platform workarounds here (FIXME-VIEWPORT: Implement same work-around for Linux/OSX!)
1386
#if !GLFW_HAS_MOUSE_PASSTHROUGH && GLFW_HAS_WINDOW_HOVERED
1387
    case WM_NCHITTEST:
1388
    {
1389
        // Let mouse pass-through the window. This will allow the backend to call io.AddMouseViewportEvent() properly (which is OPTIONAL).
1390
        // The ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag is set while dragging a viewport, as want to detect the window behind the one we are dragging.
1391
        // If you cannot easily access those viewport flags from your windowing/event code: you may manually synchronize its state e.g. in
1392
        // your main loop after calling UpdatePlatformWindows(). Iterate all viewports/platform windows and pass the flag to your windowing system.
1393
        if (viewport && (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs))
1394
            return HTTRANSPARENT;
1395
        break;
1396
    }
1397
#endif
1398
    }
1399
    return ::CallWindowProcW(prev_wndproc, hWnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
1400
}
